abstract.text: Tells the delegate that the user selected a Home screen quick action for your app, except when you’ve intercepted the interaction in a launch method.

inlineContent.text: Your shared app object.
The quick action for which you’re providing an implementation in this method.
The block you call after your quick action implementation completes, returning
or
depending on the success or failure of your implementation code.
A Boolean value that indicates whether or not your implementation succeeded.
succeeded
This method is not called for scene-based apps. If you have a scene-based app, implement
in your scene delegate instead.
Implement this method to respond to the user’s selection of a Home screen quick action for your app. When finished, call the completion handler, with an appropriate Boolean value.
It’s your responsibility to ensure the system calls this method conditionally, depending on whether or not one of your app launch methods (
or
) has already handled a quick action invocation. The system calls a launch method (before calling this method) when a user selects a quick action for your app and your app
launches
instead of
activating

The requested quick action might employ code paths different than those used otherwise when your app launches. For example, your app normally launches to display view A, but your app was launched in response to a quick action that needs view B. To handle such cases, upon launch, check whether your app is being launched via a quick action. Perform this check in your
or
method by checking for the
launch option key. The
object is available as the value of the launch option key.
If you find that your app was indeed launched using a quick action, perform the requested quick action within the launch method and return a value of
from that method. When you return a value of
, the system doesn’t call the
method.

abstract.text: A false value.
A true value.
Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
The centralized point of control and coordination for apps running in iOS.
A key indicating that the app was launched in response to the user selecting a Home screen quick action.
A set of methods to manage shared behaviors for your app.
Tells the delegate that the data for continuing an activity is available.
Tells the delegate that the activity couldn’t be continued.
Tells the delegate that the launch process is almost done and the app is almost ready to run.
Tells the delegate that the activity was updated.
Tells the delegate that the user selected a Home screen quick action for your app, except when you’ve intercepted the interaction in a launch method.
Tells the delegate if your app takes responsibility for notifying users when a continuation activity takes longer than expected.
Tells the delegate that the launch process has begun but that state restoration hasn’t occured.
An application shortcut item, also called a Home Screen dynamic quick action, that specifies a user-initiated action for your app.
Asks the delegate to perform the user-selected action.
Type to represent a Boolean value.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
